etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") + 攴(攴) (pū, "strike") + water dots added -> pouring water on a person -> purification or warning
etymology.interpretation: 攸(yōu, "distant") originally depicted actions related to authority and purification, either through warning with a stick or through water rituals. The purification aspect links to pouring water, while the warning aspect connects to correction or guidance, leading to the connotations of influence and reach associated with distance.
